intro: Diatenopteryx sorbifolia, commonly known as the sorb tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, particularly in Europe and Asia. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, deciduous leaves that are typically oval or elliptic in shape. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are edible for certain wildlife. The plant thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in forested areas or along streambanks.
